go_data.justification: The Talin dimer acts as a physical link between the Integrin dimer and the actin cytoskeleton.
Myofibrils (discrete bundles of actomyosin filaments) were uniformly distributed around the vessel.

The heart was flanked by pairs of integrin-rich pericardial cells, which function as nephrocytes, and integrin was enriched on the myocyte surface at each costamere, revealed in a striated pattern of both actin and integrin labeling.
